Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin culpāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [kulˈpa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kulˈpaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

culpar (first-person singular present culpo, first-person singular preterite culpí, past participle culpat)

  1. (transitive) to blame

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of culpar (first conjugation)
infinitive culpar
gerund culpant
past participle masculine feminine
singular culpat culpada
plural culpats culpades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present culpo culpes culpa culpem culpeu culpen
imperfect culpava culpaves culpava culpàvem culpàveu culpaven
future culparé culparàs culparà culparem culpareu culparan
preterite culpí culpares culpà culpàrem culpàreu culparen
conditional culparia culparies culparia culparíem culparíeu culparien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present culpi culpis culpi culpem culpeu culpin
imperfect culpés culpessis culpés culpéssim culpéssiu culpessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — culpa culpi culpem culpeu culpin
negative (no) — no culpis no culpi no culpem no culpeu no culpin

Related terms

[edit]
  • culpa
  • culpable
  • disculpar

References

[edit]
  • “culpar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Further reading

[edit]
  • “culpar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Galician-Portuguese culpar, probably borrowed from Latin culpāre (“blame”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [kulˈpaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

culpar (first-person singular present culpo, first-person singular preterite culpei, past participle culpado)

  1. to blame
    Antonym: desculpar
  2. to charge
    Synonyms: acusar, inculpar

Conjugation

[edit]

References

[edit]
  • Seoane, Ernesto Xosé González; Granja, María Álvarez de la; Agrelo, Ana Isabel Boullón (2006–2022), “culpar”, in Dicionario de Dicionarios do galego medieval [Dictionary of dictionaries of Medieval Galician] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Barreiro, Xavier Varela; Guinovart, Xavier Gómez (2006–2018), “culpar”, in Corpus Xelmírez: corpus lingüístico da Galicia medieval [Corpus Xelmírez: linguistic corpus of Medieval Galicia] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega
  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, editor (2006–2013), “culpar”, in Dicionario de Dicionarios da lingua galega [Dictionary of Dictionaries of the Galician language] (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega

  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, Ernesto Xosé González Seoane, María Álvarez de la Granja, editors (2003–2018), “culpar”, in Tesouro informatizado da lingua galega (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Galician-Portuguese culpar, probably borrowed from Latin culpāre (“to blame”). By surface analysis, culpa +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kuwˈpa(ʁ)/ [kuʊ̯ˈpa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kuwˈpa(ʁ)/ [kuʊ̯ˈpa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kuwˈpa(ɾ)/ [kuʊ̯ˈpa(ɾ)]
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kuwˈpa(ʁ)/ [kuʊ̯ˈpa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kuwˈpa(ɻ)/ [kuʊ̯ˈpa(ɻ)]
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kulˈpaɾ/ [kuɫˈpaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kulˈpaɾ/ [kuɫˈpaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kulˈpa.ɾi/ [kuɫˈpa.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: cul‧par

Verb

[edit]

culpar (first-person singular present culpo, first-person singular preterite culpei, past participle culpado)

  1. to blame
    Synonyms: acusar, incriminar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of culpar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person

Future culpar culpares culpar culparmos culpardes culparem
Imperative
Affirmative culpa culpe culpemos culpai culpem
Negative (não) não culpes não culpe não culpemos não culpeis não culpem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • culpa
  • culpabilidade
  • culpado
  • culpável
  • culposo
  • desculpa
  • desculpar

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin culpāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kulˈpaɾ/ [kulˈpaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: cul‧par

Verb

[edit]

culpar (first-person singular present culpo, first-person singular preterite culpé, past participle culpado)

  1. to blame
    Synonyms: culpabilizar, inculpar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of culpar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive culpar
gerund culpando
past participle masculine feminine
singular culpado culpada
plural culpados culpadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

  • culpabilidad
  • culpabilizar
  • culpable
